newsitem.title: ROMANIA: BUCHAREST BOURSE PRICES SAG IN LOW TRADING.
newsitem.headline: BUCHAREST BOURSE PRICES SAG IN LOW TRADING.

text.p: Most prices slipped on the
Bucharest bourse on Tuesday, when turnover gained some 11
million lei from the previous session but stayed thin at 44.2
million.
"We expected most prices to pick up after recent falls, but
apparently it is more and more difficult to plot a trend on
this market," a dissappointed trader said.
He said investors were still in a waiting mood. "They are
waiting for fresh listings and for election results to see
which way the wind will blow," he said.
Romania will hold presidential and parliamentary elections
on November 3. Opinion surveys put President Ion Iliescu in the
lead but unlikely to win without a run-off round later in the
month. Iliescu's leftist Party of Social Democracy is running
second or even third in polls for the parliamentary vote.
"As for turnover, today's was enough to buy a Daewoo car.
We expect it to climb some at the second weekly session on
Thursday, but not too much, only enough to buy a second-hand
Mercedes," another trader said.
Fertiliser maker Azomures SA stayed in the
limelight, accounting for 53 percent of total turnover. But it
closed 400 lei weaker at 10,100.
Two indepedent value-weighted indexes of all listed stocks
-- the VAB, computed by Vanguard SA securities, and the BIG
of Bucharest Investment Group-- fell by 1.1 percent from the
previous session to 292.1 and 290.6 points repsectively. Their
base was 1,000 points last November.
OCT 22 OCT 17 Week's change 1996 high 1996 low
-- Luli Popescu, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
